lead_paragraph: Daniele Contini of Italy won the 165-kilometer (102.5-mile) second stage of the Tour of Switzerland yesterday after a long solo attack. Contini, a 31-year-old rider for LPR, broke away after 50 kilometers and finished just over five minutes ahead of his compatriot Daniele Bennati and Erik Zabel of Germany.
